intro: Vavaea chalmersii, commonly known as the Chalmers' vavaea, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. Vavaea chalmersii is often found in heathlands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
